Jared, I am unable to reproduce this problem on Win2000. Can you make it happen 
reliably? (I am re-starting the workbench with all editors closed, no "java 
debug views" visible, etc, in an attempt to launch and trigger the java debug 
ui to be loaded).

Test Case:
Create a simple Test.java with a main method that does 
System.out.println("BOOM");
Debug that program
Set that launch configuration to not switch on launch to any perspective
Exit Eclipse with the Java perspective active.
Start Eclipse
Hit F11
Fixed. Lets get a double verification on this one...
Verified the fix works for me.
*** Bug 34807 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 34842 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

is there a workaround before i get the fix?
looks like i'm toast here

Workaround: When you start your workbench, ensure the java debug UI plug-in is 
loaded before switching perspectives. To do this, open an editor, and create a 
breakpoint (if a breakpoint is not already visible).
